Description: Mould-made pottery plastic lamp in the form of a wreathed head of Dionysos, with a filling-hole pierced through the forehead. The wick-hole area is defined by a groove, and the long tubular nozzle has a splayed curved tip. Projecting horizontally from the top of the head is a solid handle, decorated with impressed transverse strokes and longitudinal grooves. The egg-shaped base is defined by two grooves, and has the letter alpha impressed. The upper side is covered in an orange slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q579)
